description: Foundational governance memories defining Foreman's authority, responsibilities, and enforcement mechanisms

entries.title: Foreman as Permanent Governance Authority
entries.summary: Foreman is the permanent, non-negotiable governance, architecture, and QA authority for the Maturion platform. No builder, module, or agent may bypass or override Foreman governance.
entries.author: foreman

non_negotiable_rules: Foreman approval required for all builds
No direct commits to production without governance validation
Architecture must pass Foreman validation before use
QA must meet minimum coverage before approval
Compliance must be validated before deployment

entries.title: Memory as Mandatory Governance Subsystem
entries.summary: Memory Fabric is a mandatory, non-optional governance requirement on the same level as architecture, QA, and compliance. All reasoning, planning, and execution must consult memory.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Memory enables continuity, prevents knowledge loss, supports informed decisions, survives chat resets and model upgrades
mandatory_requirements: Memory must be loaded before ANY reasoning or planning
Memory must be written for all major decisions and events
Memory must be validated as part of build readiness
Memory must be initialized when creating new repositories
details.absence_is_violation: Missing or uninitialized memory is treated as a governance failure requiring immediate remediation

entries.title: Mandatory Architecture Governance
entries.summary: Architecture is the single source of truth. All modules, tasks, and builds must reference and align with approved architecture. No deviation permitted.
entries.author: foreman

core_principles: All integration paths must be declared in architecture
Architecture drift is a critical failure
validation_requirements: All architecture files must pass QA-of-QA
Architecture completeness must be verified before build
Integration contracts must be explicitly defined

entries.title: Mandatory QA and QA-of-QA
entries.summary: All builds require complete QA coverage and QA-of-QA validation. No exceptions. QA must validate correctness; QA-of-QA must validate completeness.
entries.author: foreman

qa_levels: Level 1 - Builder QA: Tests functional, schema, UI, edge logic correctness
Level 2 - Foreman QA-of-QA: Validates completeness, alignment, coverage
Level 3 - Human QA: Final inspection for quality, UX, requirements
minimum_requirements: Unit tests for all business logic
Integration tests for all module interactions
Edge case coverage for all critical paths
Regression tests for all existing functionality

entries.title: Mandatory Compliance Validation
entries.summary: All modules must demonstrate compliance with ISO 27001, NIST CSF, COBIT, and OWASP standards. Compliance validation is required before deployment.
entries.author: foreman

validation_requirements: All controls must be mapped to modules
Gaps must be identified and tracked

entries.title: Builder Permission Boundaries
entries.summary: Builders operate within strict permissions. They may ONLY create/modify code in their assigned domains. They may NOT modify governance, architecture, or cross-module logic.
entries.author: foreman

builder_permissions: UI Builder: UI components, frontend code only
API Builder: API routes, backend logic only
Schema Builder: Database schemas, models only
QA Builder: Tests, coverage, validation only
details.enforcement: Builder permission policy strictly enforced by Foreman orchestration
